intro: Goodenia neogoodenia, commonly known as the New Zealand goodenia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to the temperate climate of its native habitat. Goodenia neogoodenia is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
